questions.text: A 25-year-old girl with dysphagia to liquids more than solids undergoes a barium swallow. Which of these is expected to be seen?

options.label: A

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. Fasciotomy is done as a part of Trendelenberg procedure

questions.text: A 50-year-old male patient came with diffuse, severely contaminated perforation peritonitis due to hollow viscus. He underwent laparotomy for it. On day 7 post-op, he developed signs of wound infection and subsequently, wound showed exposure of underlying tissues as shown below. His vital signs are stable with no evidence of intra-abdominal sepsis. This patient can be managed next by:

A 30-year-old patient presented with painless right scrotal swelling for 2 months. The left testis was normal. There were enlarged para-aortic nodes. USG showed the right testicular mass. What will be the management?
An elderly patient complaints of multiple clots in his urine. Which catheter should be used in this patient to facilitate irrigation and clot removal from the urinary bladder?
Which of these is correct about PAIR procedure, in the management of hydatid cysts?

options.label: A
options.text: It stands for percutaneous aspiration, injection, and re-aspiration

options.label: B
options.text: It can be performed for pulmonary hydatids

options.label: C
options.text: Prior drug treatment with Albendazole or Praziquantel is a must

options.label: D
options.text: Cysto-biliary communication and honeycombing are not contraindications

questions.correct_answer: C. Prior drug treatment with Albendazole or Praziquantel is a must
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Prior drug treatment with Albendazole or Praziquantel is a must

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding Highly Selective Vagotomy (HSV)?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the procedure of choice for gastric ulcers

options.label: B
options.text: The pyloric nerves of Latarjet are sacrificed

options.label: C
options.text: A drainage procedure is not required

options.label: D
options.text: It has the lowest recurrence rate

questions.correct_answer: C. A drainage procedure is not required
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A drainage procedure is not required

questions.text: A 45-year-old man with a history of chronic alcohol use presents with hematemesis after a night of binge drinking. He reports multiple episodes of forceful vomiting before the onset of bleeding. Upper GI endoscopy reveals a linear mucosal tear at the gastroesophageal junction. What is the most likely management of this patient?
Which of these is not a part of emergency management of variceal bleed?
Which of these procedures is performed for rectal cancers?

A 60-year-old patient with a history of chronic constipation and antipsychotics use, presents with severe abdominal pain, distension and obstipation for the past 24 hours. Examination reveals a markedly distended and tympanic abdomen. X-ray shows a bent inner tube sign. What is the next step?

A 62-year-old woman presents to the clinic complaining of a persistent lump in her right breast. She first noticed the lump 3 months ago, and it has progressively increased in size. The lump is now approximately 6 cm x 4 cm. On examination, there is evident skin ulceration over the lump and fixity to P. Major and ribs. Based on the clinical findings, which TNM staging best categorizes the tumor in this patient?
Which of the following statements regarding burns is true?

options.label: A
options.text: First-degree burns involve the epidermis and dermis, leading to blister formation

options.label: B
options.text: The Parkland formula used to calculate fluid resuscitation in burn patients utilizes crystalloids and colloids combined, as fluids of choice

options.label: C
options.text: Full-thickness burns are associated with eschar formation

options.label: D
options.text: Inhalational burns can lead to laryngeal edema immediately after burns

questions.correct_answer: C. Full-thickness burns are associated with eschar formation
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Full-thickness burns are associated with eschar formation

questions.text: A 30-year-old male presents with recurrent episodes of abdominal pain and diarrhea for the past two years. He also reports weight loss and occasional blood in his stools. Colonoscopy reveals cobblestone mucosa, and deep fissuring ulcers. Which of the following findings are typically seen in Crohn’s and not in ulcerative colitis?

options.label: A
options.text: Higher risk of skin lesions like pyoderma

options.label: C
options.text: Superficial mucosal inflammation limited to the colon and rectum

questions.correct_answer: A. Higher risk of skin lesions like pyoderma
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Higher risk of skin lesions like pyoderma

questions.text: A 7-year-old boy is brought to the pediatric clinic with concerns about an elevated right testis in the scrotum after returning from school. On examination, the right testis is palpable in the high scrotal area. The ipsilateral scrotum is well developed. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
What is this type of hernia also known as?

A 58-year-old male with a history of diabetes underwent transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP) 6 months ago. He now presents to the clinic with absence of semen during ejaculation and cloudy urine afterward. What is the underlying mechanism of this complication?

options.label: A
options.text: Injury to the external urethral sphincter

options.label: B
options.text: Disruption of the autonomic nerve supply to the corpora of the penis

options.label: C
options.text: Overuse of coagulating diathermy during the procedure

A 50-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after experiencing a head injury while playing cricket. He initially lost consciousness but regained awareness within minutes. questions.text: Which of these is incorrect about primary survey in trauma?

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman presents for a follow-up consultation after undergoing a total thyroidectomy for a thyroid mass. A histopathological slide from her surgery is shown below. Her surgeon has discussed the next steps in management, including possible treatments and follow-up protocols. Which of the following statements is most likely correct regarding the patient's condition?
questions.correct_answer: A. Spread to bones is common
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Spread to bones is common

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman presents to the clinic with significant swelling in her left leg, which has progressively worsened over the past year. She reports that the swelling began subtly and has gradually increased to its current size. Physical examination reveals non-pitting edema of the entire left leg, with skin that appears slightly thicker than normal and without any varicosities or color change. Considering the patient's history and physical examination, which of the following is the most likely etiology of the findings?

A 55-year-old man presents to the emergency department complaining of sudden, severe abdominal pain that started a few hours after a significant alcohol binge. He appears in distress, with tenderness in the upper abdomen. Abdominal finding is shown. His medical history includes chronic alcohol use and smoking. Which diagnostic test is to be done next to confirm the suspected condition?

options.label: A

questions.text: A previously well 7-month-old male infant suddenly presents with episodes of screaming. The child appears pale and listless. The stools are red currant jelly-like. What is false regarding the above condition?

options.label: A
options.text: There is an associated feeling of hardness over the Right iliac fossa.

options.label: B
options.text: Dehydration may occur if left untreated

options.label: C
options.text: Hypertrophy of Peyer’s patches may be a trigger

options.text: The most common type in children is ileocolic

questions.correct_answer: A. There is an associated feeling of hardness over the Right iliac fossa.
questions.explanation: Ans. A) There is an associated feeling of hardness over the Right iliac fossa.

questions.text: A patient was brought to the emergency with flame burns. On clinical evaluation there were deep burns involving the entire left upper limb, the entire right upper limb and the anterior aspect of chest and abdomen. How much percentage of burns would it be classified as?
